Class CcddMacroHandler

      • clearStoredValues

        protected void clearStoredValues()
        Clear the array of expanded macro values. This should be done following any change to a macro's unexpanded value so that the unexpanded value is reevaluated when next requested

      • getFullMacroName

        Parameters:
        macroName - macro name
        Returns:
        Macro name encased in the macro identifier character(s)

        Get a list of all macro name locations in the specified text string
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • replaceMacroName

        protected java.lang.String replaceMacroName(java.lang.String oldName,
                                java.lang.String newName,
                                java.lang.String text)
        Replace all instances of the specified the macro name in the supplied text string
        Parameters:
        oldName - original macro name, including the delimiters
        newName - new macro name, including the delimiters
        text - text string in which to replace the macro name

      • insertMacroName

        protected void insertMacroName(java.awt.Window owner,
                   javax.swing.text.JTextComponent textComp,
                   CcddClassesDataTable.InputType inputType,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> validDataTypes)
        Display a pop-up combo box containing the names of the defined macros. When the user selects a macro insert it into the supplied text component
        Parameters:
        owner - dialog owning the pop-up combo box
        textComp - text component over which to display the pop-up combo box and insert the selected macro name
        inputType - input type of the text component (InputType)
        validDataTypes - list of valid data types from which to choose

      • positionMacroPopup

        Position the dialog containing the macro pop-up combo box at the text cursor position in the text component
        Parameters:
        textComp - text component over which to display the pop-up combo box

                                javax.swing.text.JTextComponent textComp)
        Get the text of the specified text component with the macro name or value inserted at the current selection point
        Parameters:
        text - macro name or value
        textComp - text component over which the pop-up combo box is displayed
        Returns:
        Text of the specified text component with the macro name or value inserted at the current selection point

      • exitMacroCombo

        private void exitMacroCombo()
        Remove the macro pop-up combo box and return to the caller

      • isMacroRecursive

        protected boolean isMacroRecursive(java.lang.String macroName)
        Check for any recursive reference in the specified macro's value
        Parameters:
        macroName - macro name
        Returns:
        true if a recursive reference is detected in the macro's value

      • getMacroValue

        protected java.lang.String getMacroValue(java.lang.String macroName)
        Get the expanded value associated with the specified macro name. If the expanded value is already known (from a previous value request) then this known value is used; otherwise the macro's expanded value is evaluated from its unexpanded value
        Parameters:
        macroName - name of the macro for which the value is needed
        Returns:
        Expanded value associated with the specified macro name; returns null if the macro doesn't exist. The isMacroRecursive flag will be set to true if the macro contains a recursive reference

      • getMacroValue

        private java.lang.String getMacroValue(java.lang.String macroName,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> referencedMacros)
        Get the value associated with the specified macro name. This is a recursive method for macros referencing other macros
        Parameters:
        macroName - macro name
        referencedMacros - list containing the macros references in a macro value path. This list is used to detect if a macro references itself, which would cause an infinite loop. Set to null to not test for recursion
        Returns:
        Value associated with the specified macro name; returns null if the macro doesn't exist

      • hasMacro

        protected static boolean hasMacro(java.lang.String text)
        Check if the supplied text contains any macro references
        Parameters:
        text - text string containing macro names
        Returns:
        true if the text contains a macro reference

      • isMacroExists

        protected boolean isMacroExists(java.lang.String macroName)
        Check if the supplied macro name is already in use (case insensitive)
        Parameters:
        macroName - macro name
        Returns:
        true if the supplied macro name is already in use

      • getMacroExpansion

        protected java.lang.String getMacroExpansion(java.lang.String text)
        Replace any macro names and sizeof() calls embedded in the supplied text with the associated macro values and data type sizes
        Parameters:
        text - text string possibly containing macro names and/or sizeof() calls
        Returns:
        Text string with any embedded macro names and sizeof() calls replaced with the associated macro values and data type sizes

      • getMacroExpansion

        protected java.lang.String getMacroExpansion(java.lang.String text,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> validDataTypes)
        Replace any macro names and sizeof() calls embedded in the supplied text with the associated macro values and data type sizes. If a list of valid data types is supplied, sizeof() calls set an error flag if the referenced data type isn't in the list
        Parameters:
        text - text string possibly containing macro names and/or sizeof() calls
        validDataTypes - List containing the valid data types when evaluating sizeof() calls; null if there are no data type constraints for a sizeof() call
        Returns:
        Text string with any embedded macro names and sizeof() calls replaced with the associated macro values and data type sizes; if no macro or sizeof() call is present the text is returned unchanged

      • replaceAllMacros

        protected java.lang.Object[][] replaceAllMacros(java.lang.Object[][] array)
        Replace any macro names embedded in the supplied string array with the associated macro values
        Parameters:
        array - array of strings containing macro names
        Returns:
        String array with any embedded macro names replaced with the associated macro values

      • getReferencedMacros

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getReferencedMacros(java.lang.String text)
        Get a list of macros referenced in the specified text string
        Parameters:
        text - text string containing macro names
        Returns:
        List of macros referenced in the specified text string. A macro name only appears once in the list even if referenced multiple times in the text string

      • getDataTypeReferences

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getDataTypeReferences(java.lang.String dataType)
        Get a list containing the macros that are dependent on the specified data type
        Parameters:
        dataType - data type name for which to search
        Returns:
        List containing the macros that are dependent on the specified data type

      • addRelatedMacros

        private void addRelatedMacros(java.lang.String macroName,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> references)
        Add the name of specified macro and the names of all macros that depend on this macro's value to the supplied list. This is a recursive method
        Parameters:
        macroName - macro name
        references - list to add this macro's name and the names of its dependent macros

      • getMacroValueByName

        private java.lang.String getMacroValueByName(java.lang.String macroName)
        Get the unexpanded macro value associated with the specified macro name
        Parameters:
        macroName - macro name
        Returns:
        Unexpanded macro value associated with the specified macro name

      • getMacroReferences

        protected java.lang.String[] getMacroReferences(java.lang.String macroName,
                                    java.awt.Component parent)
        Get a list containing the tables in the project database that reference the specified macro name. Include references in the custom values table
        Parameters:
        macroName - macro name for which to search
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        List containing the tables in the database that reference the specified macro name

      • highlightMacro

        protected void highlightMacro(java.awt.Component component,
                  java.lang.String text,
                  java.awt.Color hightlightColor)
        Highlight any macros in the the specified text component
        Parameters:
        component - reference to the table cell renderer component
        text - cell value
        hightlightColor - color used for highlighting the macro name

      • getMacroToolTipText

        protected java.lang.String getMacroToolTipText(java.lang.String text)
        Tool tip text showing any macro names embedded in the supplied text replaced with the associated macro values
        Parameters:
        text - text string containing macro names
        Returns:
        Tool tip text string showing any embedded macro names in the supplied text replaced with the associated macro values

      • updateMacros

        protected void updateMacros(java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> macroDefinitions)
                     throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Add new macros and check for matches with existing ones
        Parameters:
        macroDefinitions - list of macro definitions
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If the data field with the same same already exists and the imported field doesn't match
